summary: This bill, the "Common-Sense Law Enforcement and Accountability Now in DC Act" (CLEAN DC Act), introduced in the Senate, aims to repeal the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Amendment Act of 2022 enacted by the District of Columbia Council. The bill proposes to restore or revive any provisions of law affected by the 2022 Act as if it had never been enacted, effectively reversing the previous reforms. The bill was introduced by Senator Cruz and several co-sponsors and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
